thread.title: Activists: Syria troops advance under Russian air cover
thread.title_full: Activists: Syria troops advance under Russian air cover - US News

author: USNews
title: Activists: Syria troops advance under Russian air cover
text:
Activists say Syrian troops, amid intense Russian airstrikes, advance in central province In this photo made from the footage taken from Russian Defense Ministry official web site on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, a bomb is released from Russian Su-34 strike fighter in Syria. Activists report intense fighting between insurgents and Syrian troops in the country’s center amid new territorial gains for the government, backed by Russian airstrikes. (Russian Defense Ministry Press Service via AP)
Associated Press Oct. 12, 2015 | 6:46 a.m. EDT + More BEIRUT (AP) — Activists say Russian jets have intensified their airstrikes in a central Syrian province as government and allied troops push out insurgents from the area.
The advance Monday is the latest in a government bid to regain control of areas in the rural parts of Hama, and the Sahl al-Ghab plain. The plain links Hama to the northwestern rebel-controlled Idlib province and Latakia, a government stronghold.
The Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says 30 airstrikes were reported in Kfar Nabudeh, while government troops and Lebanon's Hezbollah fighters entered from the south.
During the last six days of ground operations, government troops have moved in on two villages in eastern Hama, Atshan and Tal Sukayk, and a third in the plain area. Activists say rebels seized one village south of Idlib.
